author: Daniel Johnson
title: Mercedes post £76.9m loss in 2014 despite winning both Formula One titles
text:
Mercedes post £76.9m loss in 2014 despite winning both Formula One titles Latest company accounts reveal losses increased by more than £25m Mercedes have seen their losses go up Photo: REX By Daniel Johnson , Formula One Correspondent 5:58PM BST 02 Oct 2015 Comments 
Mercedes posted a £76.9m loss on their way to winning both Formula One titles in 2014. 
Their company accounts reveal losses increased by more than £25m, despite both increases in prize money and sponsorship revenue. 
The team blamed both the change of regulations at the start of 2014 and the fact they had to pay out substantially more in bonuses to their 700 staff. 
Each team member received a minimum of £10,000 when they won the constructors' championship this time last year. 
That wage bill - currently at £65.2m - is likely to skyrocket even further next year, when Lewis Hamilton's new contract starts. 
Hamilton is set to earn £100m over three years if he meets all his bonus clauses.
